summary:
Research Associate III, Hummingbird Bioscience, Singapore.

Specializing in process validation and qualification for pharmaceutical and medical device industry. I bring strong technical writing skills that melds clear and concise reporting with technical expertise and a unique GMP perspective. I have led cross-functional project teams for purposes as varied as design and technology transfer, process and continual improvement, deviation investigation and resolution. 

I have built and commissioned the following facilities: 

1) Changi East NEWater Plant II.

2) AbbVie Biologics Singapore  BIO Plant.

Working with HOYA Medical Singapore, I have contributed in bringing the following products from R&D stage to the hands of ophthalmologists worldwide:

HOYA Vivinex multiSert, HOYA ezSert, HOYA Nanex

Working with Hummingbird Bioscience, I have contributed in bringing the following novel biotherapeutics from R&D stage to clinical stage development:
HMBD-001 (HER2 and HER3 oncological target)
HMBD-002 (anti-VISTA)
HMBD-501 (Next Generation HER3-Targeted Antibody-Drug Conjugate (ADC))

I am a graduate from the Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering, National University of Singapore.

currentPositions.description:
As part of the Upstream Production team that works on biotherapeutic manufacturing process optimization and cell line development.

With a focus on bioreactor process optimization, my team strives to speed up process development for Contract Research and Contract Manufacturing opportunities. We also work to adapt novel mammalian cell lines under the scope of cell line development for exploratory antibody development.

I have also undertaken cross-training with Downstream Production to perform protein purification for monoclonal antibodies using PrismA and Size Exclusion Chromatography columns. The scope of this training also includes operation and troubleshooting of the AKTA Pure machine.

Additionally, I have also performed antibody conjugation with chemotherapy chemical payloads to support the company’s expansion into the Antibody-Drug Conjugate modality for cancer.
currentPositions.title: Research Associate (III)

projects.description:
The project is a final year research project conducted at the National University of Singapore with the Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering. During this project, I was under the supervision of A/P Praveen Linga as well as the able mentorship of Dr. Ponnivalavan Babu.

This project involved the conceptualization of a batch process to use binary gas hydrates for desalination under high pressure and low temperatures. Possible industrial applications include combining the hydrate formation process with carbon dioxide capture as well as natural gas storage.

My role in this project was to plan and design the experimental process reactor to optimize the hydrocarbon capture of gas hydrate formations. The conditions used approximated deep-sea temperature and pressure conditions where gas hydrates naturally form.  In addition, I also planned and conducted experimental runs with varying carbon dioxide gas mixtures to optimize hydrocarbon capture.
projects.title: Freeze Desalination with Binary Clathrate Hydrates (Final Year Research Project)

projects.description:
The project involves the ground up design of a methanol-to-olefin plant. The plant design involves the main reaction and the separation and storage of the resulting olefins.

I was involved in the design of the separation facility for the separation, isolation and purification of the propane by-product stream.


Additionally, I led the project team for the HAZOP assessment and subsequent recommendation of the design changes to the plant for the operational health and safety of the operations.
projects.title: Design of a Methanol-to-Olefin Plant (Final Year Design Project)

headline: Mammalian Cell Line Development I Process Development I New Product Development I Design and Technology Transfer

ingestedContentSummary.description: The ‘custom trays’ also known as ‘special trays’ are fabricated so that the final impression of the patient’s edentulous mouth can be made accurately using selective pressure technique with proper border extensions. The selective pressure technique helps in making the impression in such a way that when the newly fabricated dentures are in function in the mouth of the patient, they exert pressure…
ingestedContentSummary.title: Stress Bearing Areas and Special Trays: Detailed Dental Insights

message.text: Putting masticatory load over the load bearing area of the residual alveolar ridge, sparing the non load bearing area, is extremely important for a successful denture. Yow ill learn as to how to do it in this article by the use of special trays.
